definition: an acid used in fertilizers and soaps: H3PO4

positive_examples: This is an example of phosphoric acid.
The phosphoric acid demonstrated clear characteristics.
We observed phosphoric acid in this context.
A typical case of phosphoric acid would involve these features.
The concept of phosphoric acid applies here.
A mineral acid commonly used in food flavoring, rust removal, and fertilizer production.
negative_examples: This is an example of sulfuric acid, not phosphoric acid.
This represents chemical acid in general.
The document was filed in the cabinet.
She walked to the store to buy groceries.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: SulfuricAcid, or other types of ChemicalAcid
